info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 1:08PM AKDT until May 29 at 1:15PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Falls Creek near Petersburg
* WHEN...Until 115 PM AKDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and automated gauges indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Falls Creek. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible through Wednesday night.
- For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 12:00pm the stage was 21.9 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet.
Impacts: At 24 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway.
At 24.3 feet: The water level will be a the base of the bridge abutment. At this stage the water will begin to undermine the bridge's structural integrity. This is flood stage.
At 27 feet: Water levels will be at the horizontal ibeam of the 9 mile bridge along Mitkof highway.
At 27.3 feet: The water level would be at the bottom of the steel cross sections of the bridge. This would be a major flood.
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM AKDT THURSDAY
